iaik.asn1

Class EncodedASN1Object

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.asn1.ASN1Object
      • iaik.asn1.EncodedASN1Object
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class EncodedASN1Object
extends ASN1Object
    This class represents an utility for handling encoded ASN.1 object within the IAIK ASN.1 framework.
    This class allows to incorporate a given DER encoding into an ASN.1 object without the necessity of decoding it. This may be useful in situations where an structured ASN.1 object shall be encoded and one of its components already is given in encoded format. The encoding may be supplied either as byte array or from an input stream; the latter may be preferable when dealing with large encodings. Consider for instance an already encoded SEQUENCE object to be set as the second component of a new two-component SEQUENCE object: 
     mySequence ::= SEQUENCE {   
   firstComponent INTEGER,    
   secondComponent SEQUENCE }
    Normally you would have to decode the SEQUENCE before adding it to the new SEQUENCE type: 
     SEQUENCE mySequence = new SEQUENCE();
   mySequence.addComponent(new INTEGER(2));
   mySequence.addComponent(DerCoder.decode(encodedSequence));
    The code sample above may appear as part of an toASN1Object method for giving an ASN.1 representation of an Java object to be fed immediately to the DerCoder encoding utility: 
     byte[] encoding = DerCoder.encode(myASN1Class.toASN1Object());
    Now, with class EncodedASN1Object you may avoid the decoding-encoding step by immediately supplying the encoded SEQUENCE component: 
     SEQUENCE mySequence = new SEQUENCE();
   mySequence.addComponent(new INTEGER(2));
   mySequence.addComponent(new EncodedASN1Object(encodedSequence));
    When now calling the DerCoder, the second component is encoded by only "copying" the already given encoding.

    Attention! This class only should be used very carefully and only for a purpose as described above. This class only provides very limited access to the ASN.1 functionalities accustomed from the other ASN.1 types of this packages. So, for instance, it does not have a tag number associated to it and it does not provide any decoding enhancements. This class provides nothing more than some kind of piping mechanism: the encoded bytes supplied by one of the constructures are written ("copied") unchanged to the supplied OutputStream when the DerCoder calls the encode method.

    See Also:
    ASN1Object, ASN, ConstructedType, DerCoder

      Creates an EncodedASN1Object object where the encoding is supplied from an input stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EncodedASN1Object

        public EncodedASN1Object()
        Creates an empty EncodedASN1Object. Shall not be used by an application.

      • EncodedASN1Object

        public EncodedASN1Object(byte[] encodedASN1Object)
        Creates an EncodedASN1Object object where the encoding is supplied from an byte array. This constructor does not decode the given encoded ASN.1 object! It only maintains the given encoding to be written out when the DerCoder is invoked.
        Parameters:
        encodedASN1Object - an encoded ASN.1 object supplied from a byte array

      • EncodedASN1Object

        public EncodedASN1Object(java.io.InputStream encodedStream)
        Creates an EncodedASN1Object object where the encoding is supplied from an input stream. This constructor does not decode the given encoded ASN.1 object! It only maintains the given encoding to be written out when the DerCoder is invoked.
        Parameters:
        encodedStream - an encoded ASN.1 object supplied from an input stream

      • EncodedASN1Object

        public EncodedASN1Object(java.io.InputStream encodedStream,
                 int blockSize)
        Creates an EncodedASN1Object object which reads the encoding from an InputStream and processes it into blocks of blockSize bytes. This constructor does not decode the given encoded ASN.1 object! It only maintains the given encoding to be written out when the DerCoder is invoked.
        Parameters:
        encodedStream - an encoded ASN.1 object supplied from an input stream
        blockSize - the blocksize setting the block size for in-memory processing

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Object getValue()
        Returns the encoded ASN.1 object itself.
        Specified by:
        getValue in class ASN1Object
        Returns:
        the encoded ASN.1 object as byte array or input stream.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.Object object)
        Sets the value of this object.

        The value may be supplied as byte array or input stream and represents the encoding of the ASN1Object.

        Generally there should be no need for using this method since data immediately can be supplied when creating a new simple OCTET_STRING object by means of a proper constructor.

        Specified by:
        setValue in class ASN1Object
        Parameters:
        object - the value (encoding), as byte array or input stream

      • setIndefiniteLength

        Parameters:

      • encode

        protected void encode(java.io.OutputStream os)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes this EncodedASN1Object to the given output stream. This is a protected method and will not be used by an application for DER encoding an EncodedASN1Object object. An application will call one of the encode methods of the DerCoder class for performing the encoding, and the DerCoder internally will call this encode method.
        Specified by:
        encode in class ASN1Object
        Parameters:
        os - the output stream to which to write the encoding
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during writing to the stream

      • decode

        protected void decode(int length,
          java.io.InputStream is)
               throws CodingException
        Only throws a CodingException since decoding not supported by this class.
        Specified by:
        decode in class ASN1Object
        Parameters:
        length - the already decoded length, i.e. number of the bytes representing the ASN1Object to be decoded
        is - the InputStream supplying the encoded ASN1Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the InputStream
        CodingException - since not supported by this class
